DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate effect long-chain n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acid ( n-3 LCPUFA ) immune function cardiovascular disease risk
DOC.brief_title: The Effect n-3 LCPUFA Immune Function Cardiovascular Risk Factors
DOC.detailed_description: In control , double-blinded human intervention study effect fish oil versus control ( olive oil ) high versus low consumption n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acid investigate . Sixty-seventy healthy men randomize oil capsule substitute dietary fat one two type oil butter-product provide . Outcome variables ex vivo cytokine production full blood isolate immune cell 24 h stimulation bacteria bacterial component , blood pressure arterial function , plasma concentration cholesterol , triacylglycerol , C-reactive protein number marker endothelial function cardiovascular risk . The hypothesis increase intake n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acid ( fish oil ) low consumption n-6 polyunsaturated fatty acid increase incorporation docosahexanoic acid immune cell membrane decrease inflammatory response potential improve overall cardiovascular disease risk . The mechanistic aspect explore vitro study monocyte culture presence vary amount polyunsaturated fatty acid .
DOC.criteria: Healthy ( chronic disease regular medication ) BMI > 18.5 < 27.5 kg/m2 Daily use fat home cooking > 5 d/wk Heavy exercise < 7 h/wk Not daily smoker ( < 5 cigarets/wk )
